name: Title Hide – WordPress Hide Post & Page Titles
author: Harpreet Kumar

sections.description:
Title Hide is a FREE, lightweight and user-friendly WordPress plugin that gives you control over the visibility of titles for pages and single posts on your website. Whether you need to show or hide titles, Title Hide has got you covered.

Usage

  1. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins‘ menu in WordPress.
  2. Create a new post/page or edit an existing one.
  3. On the edit screen, you’ll find a checkbox labeled “Hide title“. Check this box to hide the title.
  4. Publish or update the page/post to apply the changes.
sections.installation:
1. Upload the plugin files to the /wp-content/plugins/title-hide/ directory, or install the plugin directly through the WordPress plugins screen.
  2. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins‘ menu in WordPress.
sections.faq:
How do I hide titles from pages and single posts?

Activate the plugin, go to the plugin settings page, choose your option, and click on the ‘Save Changes‘ button.

How can I get back titles in pages and single posts?

A: Go to the plugin settings page, choose the ‘Donâ€™t Hide‘ option, and click on the ‘Save Changes‘ button.

What are the benefits of using this plugin?

Users can easily hide the title of posts, pages, or custom posts.

How do I hide the title of a page or a post?

Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins‘ menu in WordPress. Then create a new post/page or edit an existing one. Now go to the edit screen and click on the “Hide Title” option. After that, publish or update the page/post.
